name: lel

scripts.// start-explanation: 1) verify n exists. 2) verify node latest version exists while keeping the machine's original node version installed. 3) start app with node latest version
scripts.start: INSTALL_V=8.1.2 && ([ -a /usr/local/bin/n ] || sudo npm i -g n) && ([ -d /usr/local/n/versions/node/$INSTALL_V ] || (CURRENT_V=$(node -v) && sudo n $INSTALL_V && sudo n $CURRENT_V)) && n use $INSTALL_V node_modules/.bin/gulp watch --color
scripts.// test-explanation: 1) start app in the background and save its process id. 2) run tests in tests folder. 3) kill app with saved process id.
scripts.test: gulp & SERVER_PID=$!; (cd tests; npm i && node run-tests.js); kill $SERVER_PID
scripts.// postinstall-explanation: this task is run by heroku after deploying, so it compiles the output files

//: No devDependencies. Everything needed for compilation is in dependencies, because heroku compiles the files
